content:
I have been wanting to get into the type-solver (i think its also referred to as the trait engine) for a while, as well as the way that Region's work in rustc, but I feel totally lost. I feel in small chunks I can grasp some basic concepts, but as a whole, the terms and structure of the code have me quite lost, and they seem very abstracted from how the type system works in my head when I'm programming in rust

Are there any good resources (including textbooks) to get at least some familiarity with how real type solvers work? I never took a typing class in college, I have Types and Programming Languages, but im wondering if that is too theoretical
